entry.title: Game: Cthuluhu Saves the World (Steam, 2011) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Cthuluhu Saves the World (Steam, 2011) (2)20140120
I played for about an hour and went through the next
dungeon. Strangely, there was a reference to "Alma the Younger" as
being one of the heroes who gone through the Shrine of Heroes. The
enemy descriptions are so funny.

--

Later in the day I did another hour or so. I did two areas and
visited Providence. I found some of the fights in the Mist Forest
to be really difficult, especially the final boss. I just barely
won. There's such a big desire to get a huge combo and finish the
boss off in one go, but I wonder if it isn't really a good
strategy.

Total time: 3:24
  • Video Games
  • Cthuluhu Saves the World
  • Steam
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013) (13)
entry.content:
Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013) (13)20140120
I played a series today in about thirty five minutes, plus an
attempt at the two series (kart and naturally aspirated) that have
been giving me trouble. When I hit a wall in my ability in this
game, it is incredibly frustrating and makes me not want to play
it at all, which is I why I haven't played for about a month.

International B - 23% - 45 - 156 - 19 - 120 - 54 - $952.419k

entry.title: Game: BIT.TRIP BEAT (Steam, 2010)
entry.content:
Game: BIT.TRIP BEAT (Steam, 2010)20140118
I played this for about 10 minutes with my 360 controller and it
felt impossibly imprecise, so I don't want to play it. I bet I
could fiddle with the sensitivity or try different controllers,
but I don't feel like going through that much effort for it. The
game seems really unique though.

Total time: 0:10
  • Video Games
  • BIT.TRIP BEAT
  • Steam
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: BIT.TRIP RUNNER (Steam, 2011) (2)
entry.content:
Game: BIT.TRIP RUNNER (Steam, 2011) (2)20140118
I played today for about an hour and beat the other two
levels. The beginning of this game was pretty fun and unique, but
as the levels get longed, it ceases to be as fun, because it feels
like it just about memorizing a pattern. The "boss" fight is the
worst because you cannot anticipate what the enemy is going to
drop on you and you really need to just straight-up memorize
it. One person on my friends list had played the game and given up
at that point, so I imagine a lot of people get turned off
there. I did the first level of Zone 2 and saw that they added
some mechanics but it felt too painful already, so I didn't go
through it.

A good, but flawed, game.

Total time: 2:13
  • Video Games
  • BIT.TRIP RUNNER
  • Steam
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: VVVVVV (Steam, 2010) (2)
entry.content:
Game: VVVVVV (Steam, 2010) (2)20140118
I played through this whole game today in about two hours and got
13 of the trinkets. It was awesome. I'm very curious about the
player levels. Maybe the next time I feel like playing it, I will
do those?

I played this time with a SNES controller and it was a pretty
awesome choice.

Game     2: 2:09

entry.title: Cosmos: A Personal Voyage - Season 1 - Episode 11 - The Persistence of Memory
entry.content:
Cosmos: A Personal Voyage - Season 1 - Episode 11 - The Persistence of Memory20140117
This was an exciting episode about brains and memories. I love
the idea that technology is really just fast evolution and we
should consider it as part of our species. It does mean that when
the technology isn't common between two groups, and more so when
the distance is vast, they aren't even really the same
species. This explains the unfeeling conflict between Europeans
and the natives of North America, for instance.
  • TV Shows
  • Cosmos: A Personal Voyage

entry.title: Game: BIT.TRIP RUNNER (Steam, 2011)
entry.content:
Game: BIT.TRIP RUNNER (Steam, 2011)20140116
I played this for about an hour and a half. I got up to the last
level of the first world. In almost every level I was able to get
all the Gold, but I found it really challenging to get the ones
where you had to "kick" after going on a spring. It was a
pain. This game is really fun though.

entry.title: Game: New Super Mario Brothers Wii (Wii, 2009) (11)
entry.content:
Game: New Super Mario Brothers Wii (Wii, 2009) (11)20140116
We played for thirty minutes and beat the last level, then went
back to 9-7. We got nearly to the end a few times but little
mistakes ended in our death. Next time!

--

Later in the day, we played for another forty-five minutes and
beat the game. We watched all the movies and got 99 lives. Our
save file have 5 Shining Stars, World 9, and 99 Lives. Nice!

This game is so amazing. I can't wait to break out the WiiU and
play those games with my wife.

Total time: 36:19
  • Video Games
  • New Super Mario Brothers Wii
  • Wii
  • 2009

entry.title: Game: Mega Man X2 (SNES, 1994) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Mega Man X2 (SNES, 1994) (2)20140115
I played today for about thirty minutes today and played one
continue against the Gator boss. I died but came pretty close to
winning. I find this game to be very painful to play because you
have to constantly wall jump while holding down a charge
shot. Ouch.

entry.content:

I love this movie so much. There are so many moments that make me

entry.title: Game: Recettear: An Item Shop's Tale (Steam, 2010)
entry.content:
Game: Recettear: An Item Shop's Tale (Steam, 2010)20140114
I played this game for about an hour. I got passed the first week
with a huge profit and got my adventurer's level up a lot. The
game is pretty cute, but too basic for my taste. It is basically
just about grinding, but the mechanics of battles aren't
particularly good compared to best-in-class action RPGs. 

I don't regret spending an hour with the game, but I do regret
spending $5 on it during the Steam sale. I think the subject
matter is very cute and the concept is very unique, but neither is
strong enough to support the bland mechanics.

Total time: 1:14
  • Video Games
  • Recettear: An Item Shop's Tale
  • Steam
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Breath of Death VII (Steam, 2010) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Breath of Death VII (Steam, 2010) (2)20140113
I beat the game tonight in about an hour. I was kind of
disappointed by the last dungeon, because it was so easy. I
grinded at the first save point so I could explore without random
battles. I creamed the dopplegangers and the last boss was easy as
well with regeneration. The game was fun overall, especially for
its length and cost.

Total time: 4:45
  • Video Games
  • Breath of Death VII
  • Steam
  • 2010

entry.title: Cosmos: A Personal Voyage - Season 1 - Episode 10 - The Edge of Forever
entry.content:
Cosmos: A Personal Voyage - Season 1 - Episode 10 - The Edge of Forever20140113
This was a great episode. I really enjoyed the perspective on the
different ways that the topology of our universe could be
like. The shadow of the hypercube was super cool. I was amazed at
the idea that a snowflake is more "powerful" than all the energy
our telescopes have observed.
  • TV Shows
  • Cosmos: A Personal Voyage

entry.title: Game: Breath of Death VII (Steam, 2010)
entry.content:
Game: Breath of Death VII (Steam, 2010)20140112
I started this today played for about two hours. I got passed the
bonus cave 3. The game is a lot more basic in so many ways than
the other Zeboyd games, but it has a few cool things going for
it. I particularly like the jokey dialogue about RPG tropes.

Later in the day I played for another two hours and beat the
Turrets.

Total time: 3:46
